title: Juventus advance to knockouts after victory over Benfica
summary: Two second-half goals for Juventus confirm their progression in the Champions League with a win over Jose Mourinho's Benfica at the Allianz Stadium.

title: Athletic Club edge past Atalanta in five-goal thriller
summary: Athletic Club produce a stirring second-half fightback to dent Atalanta's hopes of automatically reaching the last 16 of the Champions League, while boosting their own play-off ambitions.

title: Lopez stunner helps Barca win six-goal thriller
summary: Fermin Lopez scores twice, including a stunning curling effort, as Barcelona beat Slavia Prague in a six-goal thriller in the Champions League.

title: Kane double fires Bayern Munich past  Union SG
summary: Harry Kane scores twice and misses a penalty as 10-man Bayern Munich secure their place in the last 16 of the Champions League with a comfortable victory over Union Saint-Gilloise.

title: Salah returns as Liverpool score three to beat Marseille
summary: Mohammad Salah returns to the Liverpool starting XI as Liverpool score three goals, including an intelligent Dominik Szoboszlai free kick, to beat Olympique Marseille.

title: Chelsea keep top-eight hopes alive with win over Pafos
summary: Moises Caicedo's 77th-minute goal keeps Chelsea's hopes of finishing in the Champions League top eight alive after victory of Pafos at Stamford Bridge.

title: Newcastle secure last-16 play-off spot after comfortable win over PSV
summary: Newcastle United clinch a Champions League last 16 play-off spot following a comfortable 3-0 win over PSV Eindhoven at St James's Park.

title: Llorente own goal earns Galatasaray  draw with Atletico
summary: An own goal from Atletico Madrid's Marcus Llorente earns Galatasaray a draw after Giuliano Simeone gave the visitors an early lead, as both sides fail to find the net in the second half.

title: Qarabag score last-gasp winner to seal comeback win over Frankfurt
summary: Qarabag score a dramatic stoppage-time winner to end Eintracht Frankfurt's hopes of reaching the Champions League play-offs and keep their own alive.

title: Wissa scores first Newcastle Champions League goal
summary: Yoane Wissa capitalises on a PSV mistake to score his first Champions League goal for Newcastle United.

title: Kaptein goal sends Chelsea into seventh straight League Cup final
summary: Holders Chelsea reach a seventh successive final of the Women's League Cup with a narrow victory over rivals Manchester City at Joie Stadium.

title: Spurs beat 10-man Dortmund to ease pressure on Frank
summary: Goals from Cristian Romero and Dominic Solanke help Tottenham Hotspur to a comfortable win against Borussia Dortmund, giving manager Thomas Frank a much needed boost.

title: Suarez strikes late to give Lisbon win over PSG
summary: Sporting Lisbon stun current Champions League holders Paris Saint-Germain with a 2-1 victory. Striker Luis Suarez netted a brace including a 90th-minute winner.

title: Mbappe scores twice as Real thrash Monaco
summary: Kylian Mbappe scores twice with Jude Bellingham also on target as Real Madrid thrash Monaco in Alvaro Arbeloa's first Champions League game in charge of the Spanish side.

title: Arsenal extend perfect Champions League record with victory in Milan
summary: Gabriel Jesus scores twice as Arsenal win at Inter Milan to maintain their 100% record in the Champions League.

title: Bodo/Glimt humble Man City with stunning home win
summary: Kasper Hogh scores twice as Norwegian debutants Bodo/Glimt claim one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history by beating Manchester City 3-1.

title: Defeat for 10-player Arsenal as Man Utd reach first League Cup final
summary: Manchester United reach the Women's League Cup final for the first time with a narrow 1-0 victory against Arsenal, in a rain-drenched semi-final at Meadow Park.

title: Aston Villa target Loftus-Cheek - Thursday's gossip
summary: Ruben Loftus-Cheek emerges as Aston Villa and Man Utd target, Spurs weigh up Crysencio Summerville move, Liverpool interested in Micky van de Ven and Forest eye Kostas Tsimikas.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
